Topic.Title: The economy has fully recovered, I can't believe that Obama has saved the country from the Republican party.

Message.Msg: All of this is similar to having a Teenage Daughter having a credit card that she has run up to astronomical levels that you can't even begin to pay off for her... ... when she hits her credit limit, she goes into a personal, 2008-style, personal "depression" but if you react to that by extending her credit limit on the card, then it's party-time for her and she feels "economically fantastic"... even though you're stampeding further into debt. If the U.S. generates 3% growth as a result of historically massive deficits and money printing, you're right... it feels great and stocks go up.... but we're doing what Greece was doing years ago, my friend... and Mr. Obama is bankrupting our country with this madness. S

Message.Title: stock split
Message.Msg: a stock split would be a awesome move by ceo at this time dont u agree?

Message.Title: GREEDINESS MADE ME LOOOOK STUPPIDD!!!
Message.Msg: DID NOT SELL APPLE @700

This topic is brought up often. IBM will not vote to split the stock as they have a "roadmap to $20" in place by the year 2015. After 2015, there will be another plan announced, and the stock may be split at that time? It does not make any sense to spend billions on stock buybacks just to dilute the shares.

Message.Msg: Obama has reduced the deficit. You must be mistaking this 'sister' with her other sister who did run up the debt. It was less than $1T when Raygun cut taxes and increased spending. There's a history of the debt at irs website. Check it out. You've been watching too much Faux News.

Topic.Title: The economy has fully recovered, I can't believe that Obama has saved the country from the Republican party.

Message.Msg: for his day, Ronnie Reagan ran up huge deficits. I doubt whether that Alzheimer's man even realized all his social damage or cared

IBM has been splitting often (but not the stock price). They disrespect, insult, and degrade employees by resource actions (i.e. firings), unfair performance assessments (that are driven by financials and fake payouts vs. true employee performance) and regularly scheduled salary reductions. It's sad that this behavior is so short-sighted, holding up the fabricated financials and accounting tricks, and solely focused on the 2015 Road Kill (err, Road Map). Eventually that time will end. When all talent has left or been fired, and IBM truly stands for "Indians Badly Managed"... though the India folks are getting screwed royally too, which is why most leave within 1-2 years after getting pathetically trained, but more importantly, "IBM" can be listed on their resume. Here's a thought... happy employees will drive stockholder value... duh! Just wait and see how it all eventually works out.
yes but the split this time will be ......... 4 4 1

Topic.Title: The economy has fully recovered, I can't believe that Obama has saved the country from the Republican party.

Message.Msg: They went over $1 trillion after the economic crash that occurred near the end of the Bush/Pelosi/Reid era but they have STAYED over $1 trillion for the entire 4 years of the Obama 1st term when all we did was legislate new entitlements and submit no budgets out of the Reid Senate... all while running up $5 trillion of new debt. Since it's been so fashionable to blame a president's performance on the previous administration... lets stick with your process, Larry... the president before the current term of office was Barack Obama and it's historically the worst, post-recession recovery in American History... ... The worst. We have huge deficits, huge money printing... but we're only getting 2 to 3% GDP growth, a 50-year low in capital spending, and we are very close to the all-time record low rate of "labor participation" (the all-time record low occurred 4 months ago in September). We are a sick country and Obama's socialism is no more the answer than Castro's or Chavez's socialism were... both of whom were ardent supporters of Obama's re-election.
